text:
Hi Hans-Peter,

Correct me if i'm wrong, but wouldn't you be able to pass the calculated value as a URL param? Or am I missing something in the flow of this form?

Or, because you are saving the calculated price in HubSpot, you could just create a form where you pre populate the fields with known values. That way, the user gets to see the calculated price from the previous step.

Update: looks like I can simply output that with `{{ topic }}` :blush:
Discovered it indirectly at <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/hubl/blog-content-markup> under ‘If topic statement’

I have a problem with a template, but I need to know about the HubSpot framework.
I had published the template, but some modules seem it but others not, when previewing it using “live” the new modules appears, but into the webpage, it isn’t.
What do I need to do?

In many cases, developers only made structure of page on the templates,
And on the webpages, they insert or change contents
So you need to modify webpage too
if you change content on the template, it will not affect to webpage which is using that template
My template was set up with a slick slider at the top, which is not pulling into the webpage I built from the template. Is what you are describing here the problem?
